title: Make Dashboard title editable, add Notes app, and add Tests tracking with per-test graphs

requirements.text: Replace the hardcoded Dashboard hero heading text "Friday" with an in-place, user-editable title on the Dashboard page, and persist the title in LocalStorage so it is restored on reload.

quotes: REMOVE NAME FRIDAY AND LET IT BE COSTUMIZABLE THERE IT SELF

acceptanceCriteria: On the Dashboard (route '/'), the hero heading is no longer hardcoded to "Friday".
The heading can be edited directly on the Dashboard (in-place edit UX) without navigating to another page.
The edited title persists via LocalStorage and is restored after a refresh/reopen.
All user-facing text and placeholders used for this edit UI are in English.

requirements.text: Add a new "Notes" option accessible from the app menu (the left-side hamburger drawer) that opens a dedicated Notes page implementing a basic phone-notes style experience: create, view, edit, delete notes; persist all notes in LocalStorage.

quotes: ADD A OPTION IN MENU NOTE WHICH SHOULD WORK AS A BASIC NOTE APP IN EVERY PHONE

acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/notes') exists and renders a Notes page.
The hamburger drawer includes a clear navigation entry labeled "Notes" that navigates to the Notes page.
Users can create a note (title optional, body required), edit an existing note, and delete notes.
Notes are persisted in LocalStorage with versioning (similar robustness to existing LocalStorage hooks) and are restored after reload.
Notes UI is mobile-first and usable on desktop; all labels are English.
No backend changes are required for notes.

requirements.text: Add a new "Tests" area as a dedicated dashboard page where the user can manage unlimited tests: create tests with a customizable label/name, configurable total marks, and record scored marks entries; persist all test data in LocalStorage.

quotes: ADD ANOTHER DASH BORD DOWN CALLED TESTS
I CAN COSTUMISE LABEL OF THE TESTS
ICAN ADD AS MANY TESTS AS I CAN
ICAN COSTUMIZE TOTAL MARKS OF THE TEST AND HOW MUCH I HAVE SCORE IN THAT TEST

acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/tests') exists and renders a Tests page.
Users can create unlimited tests with fields: test label/name and total marks.
Within each test, users can add one or more score entries (scored marks; optionally include date/time of entry).
Users can edit and delete tests and edit/delete individual score entries.
All test data is persisted in LocalStorage with versioning and restored after reload.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: For each test on the Tests page, display a customizable graph similar to common NTA-style test progress charts, with user controls to adjust the graph appearance (at minimum: chart type line vs bar, and an accent color).

quotes: FOR EVERY MAIN TEST LABEL THERE SHOULD BE A GRAPH WHICH CAN BE COSTUMIZABLE WHICH WE CAN OFTENLYY SEEN IN NTA APP TEST

acceptanceCriteria: Each test displays a chart of score entries (e.g., score over attempts in entry order, or by date if present).
The chart has per-test customization controls that change the chart appearance (minimum: line vs bar; and a selectable accent color).
Graph customization selections persist in LocalStorage as part of the test data and are restored after reload.
The graph renders correctly on mobile widths without overflowing and remains readable in dark mode.
All graph-related labels and controls are in English.

requirements.text: Update navigation so "Tests" is easily accessible on mobile and desktop: add a clear entry point in the bottom navigation and in the hamburger drawer, consistent with existing styling.

quotes: ADD ANOTHER DASH BORD DOWN CALLED TESTS

acceptanceCriteria: Bottom navigation includes a "Tests" item that routes to the Tests page.
Hamburger drawer includes a "Tests" navigation entry.
Navigation highlights the active route consistently with existing nav behavior.
No existing routes (/ , /math, /physics, /chemistry, /calendar, /customize) are broken.

constraints: Frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui must not be edited directly; compose them as-is.
Do not edit any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx and auth/actor hooks).
Keep persistence client-side in LocalStorage (no external databases or third-party services).
Backend remains single-actor; avoid adding backend requirements unless strictly necessary.
nonGoals: No integration with NTA or any third-party test platform APIs.
No real-time sync across devices or cloud backup.
No push notifications or messaging for notes/tests.
No changes to Internet Identity authentication flow.
